action.action-desc: Ms. Hageman (for herself and Mr. Golden of Maine) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To require the United States Postal Service to post notices of changes that will affect nationwide postal services, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Instituting Notification Formalities On Reorganizing Mail Act of 2025 or the INFORM Act of 2025.

section.header: Requiring notices relating to changes in nature of postal services
section.text: Section 3661 of title 39, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by striking The and inserting In General.—The;

subparagraph.text: by inserting Change in Nature of Postal Services.— before When; and
by striking When and all that follows, and inserting the following:

paragraph.text: When the Postal Service determines that there should be a change in the nature of postal services which will generally affect service on a nationwide or substantially nationwide basis, it shall—

subparagraph.text: submit a proposed change, within a reasonable time prior to the effective date of the change, to the Postal Regulatory Commission requesting an advisory opinion on the change; and

on the date such proposed change is submitted to the Postal Regulatory Commission, post a notice of the change within affected storefront postal facilities, to remain posted for no fewer than 30 days after the change has gone into effect, and such notice shall include—

clause.text: associated timelines related to the implementation of the change;
anticipated impacts on nationwide postal services;
details of any public meetings and opportunities for public comment;
contact information for public comment; and
other helpful resources as deemed necessary by the Postal Service.

paragraph.text: by redesignating subsection (c) as paragraph (2) of subsection (b); and
in paragraph (2) of subsection (b) (as so redesignated)—

subparagraph.text: by inserting Hearing and Opinion of Commission.— before The Commission; and
by striking proposal and inserting proposed change.
